snippet: The gene variant responsible for blondness in dark-skinned indigenous islanders is distinctly different from the gene that causes blond hair in Europeans, researchers report.
abstract: Study published in journal Science identifies gene responsible for the strikingly blonde hair exhibited by about 10 percent of the indigenous inhabitants of the Solomon Islands; finds that gene is distinctly different from the one that causes blonde hair in Europeans.
lead_paragraph: The gene variant responsible for blondness in dark-skinned indigenous islanders is distinctly different from the gene that causes blond hair in Europeans, researchers report.

headline.print_headline: Island’s Genetic Quirk: Dark Skin, Blond Hair
headline.seo: Another Genetic Quirk of the Solomon Islands: Blond Hair
headline.main: Island’s Genetic Quirk: Dark Skin, Blond Hair
